channel.title: Infinite Energy
channel.description: Ok, can someone get me the tut for infinite energy? I think it got deleted during the mass deletion. Anyways Good Night..

item.title: Infinite Energy
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

hmm…that was just a guess, remove it for now ill have to look if you want a command…thats easier

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("infiniterun")) {
playerEnergy = 999999;
sendMessage("Run Forest Run");
}

and just like on the welcome message put it there so they know it

Read full topic

item.title: Infinite Energy
item.dc:creator: @jordan7 Jordan7
item.description:
@jordan7 wrote:

I get this…

Player.java:50: int cannot be dereferenced for (int i = 0; i<playerEnergy.length; i++) { //Setting Item amounts ^ Player.java:51: array required, but int found playerEnergy[i] = 9999999; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Infinite Energy
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

think i got it, go into player.java and search for

playerXP[i] = 14000000;

the code around it should look like this

for (int i=0; i<playerLevel.length; i++) { //Setting Levels
			if (i == 3) {
				playerLevel[i] = 99;
				playerXP[i] = 14000000;
			} else {
				playerLevel[i] = 1;
				playerXP[i] = 0;
			}

in some cases just look down a bit, its way up top in player.java
now, under the last } add this

for (int i = 0; i<playerEnergy.length; i++) { //Setting Item amounts
			playerEnergy[i] = 9999999;
		}

Read full topic
